name: George Porter
content: George Porter's Web Page George Porter Professor Computer Science and Engineering University of California, San Diego (affiliated with Seventh College) Office: EBU3B 3104 (Directions to my office are here) Co-Director, Center for Networked Systems Office Hours (Winter 2025): By appointment Recent professional activity Co-founder, inFocus Networks Member, Board of Directors, USENIX TPC Co-Chair, ACM SIGCOMM 2025 Member, USENIX NSDI Steering Committee Contact: Email: gmporter@cs.ucsd.edu Blue Sky: @georgemporter.bsky.social Research overview I build networks that enable high-performance, scalable, and sustainable computer systems. About me I am a Professor in the Systems and Networking Group in the Department of Computer Science and Engineering at the University of California, San Diego. I'm the Co-Director of the Center for Networked Systems, and a Co-Founder of inFocus Networks. I have received a Google Focused Research Award, a NetApp Faculty Fellowship, and the NSF CAREER award. Previous to joining U.C. San Diego, I obtained my Ph.D. from the RAD Lab in the Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences Department at U.C. Berkeley. Before that I was an undergraduate in the Department of Computer Sciences at U.T. Austin. Publications and CV Link to my publications Link to my CV Selected projects C3-Lab: Integrated Innovation for de-carbonizing datacenters Circuit-switched network designs Burst-parallel computing TritonSort/Themis/CloudBurst Teaching CSE 124: Networked Systems (Spring 2025, Fall 2022, Fall 2021, Fall 2020, Winter 2020, Winter 2019, Spring 2018, Fall 2017, Winter 2017, Winter 2016, Winter 2015) CSE 190: The Environmental Impact of Modern Computing (Spring 2021) CSE 222A: Computer Communication Networks (Fall 2024, Winter 2020, Spring 2017, Fall 2015) CSE 229A: Systems and Networking Seminar (Winter 2018, Winter 2017, Winter 2016, Fall 2015, Spring 2015) CSE 223b: Graduate Distributed Computing and Systems (Spring 2019) CSE 224: Graduate Networked Systems (Spring 2025, Winter 2023, Winter 2022, Fall 2020, Fall 2019,Fall 2018, Spring 2018) CSE 291: Data Center Networking (Spring 2015) CSE 291: The Environmental Impact of Modern Computing (Spring 2022) CSE 294: Systems and Networking Seminar (Fall 2024, Fall 2021, Spring 2017, Spring 2011) Students Current Rukshani Athapathu (Ph.D., 2021—present) Amanda Tomlinson (Ph.D., 2021—present) Alumni Gagan Gopalaiah (M.S., 2022&mdash2024) Mayank Jain (M.S., 2023&mdash2024) Runlong Su (M.S., 2023&mdash2024) Yibo Guo (Ph.D., 2018&mdash2024) Malcolm McSwain (M.S., 2022—2024) [Thesis] Joshua Santillan (B.S., 2022—2023) Lixiang Ao (Ph.D., 2016—2022, joint with Geoff Voelker) [Dissertation] Rob McGuinness (Ph.D., 2015—2021) [Dissertation] Shelby Thomas (Ph.D., 2016—2020) [Dissertation] William M.
